definition: to set sail on a voyage to a distant place/(fig.) to undertake a great mission
abbr. for 揚州|扬州[Yang2 zhou1]/surname Yang
to raise/to hoist/the action of tossing or winnowing/scattering (in the wind)/to flutter/to propagate
variant of 揚|扬[yang2]
sail/Taiwan pr. [fan2], except 帆布[fan1 bu4] canvas
variant of 帆[fan1]
to gallop/Taiwan pr. [fan2]/variant of 帆[fan1]
to distance oneself from (classical)
far/distant/remote/(intensifier in a comparison) by far/much (lower etc)
boat/ship/craft/to navigate/to sail/to fly

sentences.english: The sea in the sails, call your motivate you struggled to climb the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 大海在召唤你扬帆远航，高山在激励你奋力攀登。

sentences.english: Even as We sail and sail, We are a still picture.
sentences.chinese: 即使在我们启航，扬帆远航，我们是一个静止图像。

sentences.english: Have tough-minded boy only, ability appeases billows, hoist the sails Yuan Hang.
sentences.chinese: 只有意志坚强的小伙子，才能平息波澜，扬帆远航。

sentences.english: Globalization has not turned out to be the rising tide that lifts all boats.
sentences.chinese: 全球化没有成为使所有船只扬帆远航的东风。

sentences.english: The sea is calling you sail, motivate you struggled to climb the mountain.
sentences.chinese: 大海在召唤你扬帆远航，高山在激励你奋力攀登。

sentences.english: For my purpose holds to sail beyond the sunset.
sentences.chinese: 为了理想我扬帆远航去超越落日。

sentences.english: Life in fierce dynamic, at any time by the sails of cup be puzzled.
sentences.chinese: 生活处于激烈变动之中，随时受扬帆远航的盅惑。

definition: (of a ship) to set sail/(of an aeroplane) to take off/also written 啟航|启航[qi3 hang2]
to set sail
lit. to ride the wind and crest the waves/to be ambitious and unafraid (idiom)
(of a ship) to set sail/(of an aeroplane) to take off/also written 起航[qi3 hang2]
to brave the wind and the billows (idiom); to have high ambitions
ship (e.g. providing regular passenger service)
to travel a great distance by sea or air/voyage/long-haul flight
to weigh anchor
to advance bravely/to endeavor
sail/sailing boat
large ship/large wheel
to weigh anchor
to spread one's wings and soar (idiom)/to develop one's abilities freely
to follow the past and herald the future (idiom); part of a historical transition/forming a bridge between earlier and later stages
to walk hand in hand/to cooperate
long journey/trek/course of an expedition
